intro: Meliosma paupera var. repandoserrata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed meliosma, is a member of the Sapindaceae family. It is a small, deciduous shrub characterized by its finely divided, pinnate leaves with serrated margins. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often greenish in color, and it produces small, woody fruits. The species is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including China and India.
